intro: Corydalis verna, commonly known as spring corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, early spring blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lower petals that curve backward, giving it a distinctive appearance. Corydalis verna thrives in woodland or shaded areas and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
